## Teaching Material to introduce trait-based diversity to bachelor students using R

In this teaching material led by [Laura Richardson](https://www.bangor.ac.uk/staff/sos/laura-richardson-061068/en), we propose a set of one introductory lecture, three practicals in R and one symposium with a poster session, to learn what is functional diversity, how to compute a multidimensional space based on species traits, diverse functional indices and their meaning, based on an ecological question and field data ğŸ ğŸª¸

You can find the Teaching material [here](http://tiee.esa.org/vol/v20/issues/data_sets/richardson/abstract.html) !

Using this teaching material, students learn how to:
1- Get to know their dataset & traits data using R ğŸ”
2- Learn basic operations of data manipulation and plot using the #ggplot2 package ğŸ“‰
3- Develop hypotheses on coral bleaching's impact on fish FDğŸª¸
4- Learn how to build a multi-traits space via PCoA  & what it representsğŸš€
5- Compute FD indices & understand their meaningğŸ§ 
6- Test their hypotheses using stat testsğŸ§®
7- Present their results in a posterğŸ†
